chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
items.plainText: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

items.text: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?
items.plainText: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?

items.text: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
items.plainText: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

items.text: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.
items.plainText: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.

items.text: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
items.plainText: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

items.text: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?
items.plainText: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?

items.text: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?
items.plainText: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?

items.text: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.
items.plainText: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.

items.text: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.
items.plainText: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.

items.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
items.plainText: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

items.text: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion's whelps are scattered abroad.
items.plainText: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion's whelps are scattered abroad.

items.text: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.
items.plainText: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.

items.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
items.plainText: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,

items.text: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.
items.plainText: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.

items.text: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:
items.plainText: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:

items.text: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,
items.plainText: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,

items.text: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?
items.plainText: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?

items.text: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:
items.plainText: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:

items.text: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?
items.plainText: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?

items.text: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.
items.plainText: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.

items.text: Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
items.plainText: Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
